description.value:
All gunslingers have a particular way they follow, a combination of philosophy and combat style that defines both how they fight and the weapons they excel with. At 1st level, your way grants you an initial deed, a unique reload action called a slinger's reload, and proficiency with a particular skill. You also gain advanced and greater deeds at later levels, as well as access to way-specific feats.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Way of the Drifter]{Way of the Drifter} You wander across the battlefield, equally at home in and out of the fray.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Way of the Pistolero]{Way of the Pistolero} You carefully maintain your distance at a duelist's 10 paces with pistol in hand.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Way of the Sniper]{Way of the Sniper} You practice a methodical style of shooting, striking from far cover.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Way of the Vanguard]{Way of the Vanguard} You rely on a brutal combat style that uses heavy weapons and explosive attacks.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Way of the Triggerbrand]{Way of the Triggerbrand} You prefer firearms that work well as weapons in both melee and ranged combat
